articles.author: Momenul Ahmad
articles.description:
Okay, seeing a completely for a live site with blank page for demosites.demo.com (either a domain or a subdomain) can be caused by several issues, ranging from DNS configuration to server-side problems.
Here‚Äôs a breakdown of the most likely reasons and how to troubleshoot:
Apex Domain and Subdomain: DNS Propagation Issues:
Check: Use an online DNS checker tool (like dnschecker.org) and enter demosites.demo.com. See if it resolves to the correct IP address or CNAME target across different locations. Also, try clearing your local DNS cache.
Incorrect DNS Records:
Learn more- Site with blank page for the Domain and Subdomain, what could be the possible reason?


  
  
  DNS #DNSRecord #CNAME #IP #Server #Serverless #headless #domainpropagation #indexhtml #indexphp #hosting #servererror #blankpage #domainissue #seosiri #momenulahmad
articles.title: Site with blank page for the Domain and Subdomain, what could be the possible reason?

articles.author: An Architect
articles.description:
When designing a system that handles a lot of incoming data‚Äîlike transactions, logs, messages or orders‚Äîyour priority is not reading that data, but writing it fast and efficiently. These systems are called write-heavy systems.
This guide breaks down the process in a way that anyone can understand, with an analogy that sticks. Whether you're a beginner building your first backend or a seasoned engineer setting up a scalable pipeline, this is your go-to checklist.
In our analogy:
In a write-heavy system, people are mostly placing orders‚Äînot just browsing the menu.
Let's walk through how to set up a system that can take those orders quickly and reliably.
Before choosing databases or tech stacks, ask yourself:
What kind of data is being written? (e.g., chat messages, transactions, logs)
How fr‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Design a Write-Heavy System: A Beginner-Friendly Guide You‚Äôll Want to Bookmark

articles.author: Ciphernutz
articles.description:
Crypto AI agents are currently autonomously managing blockchain transactions, DApps, and numerous other blockchain-based technologies, and they're working perfectly. The AI agents performing crypto portfolio management duties are also effectively multiplying the investments and holdings for the owners.
So, what does it take to build your own crypto AI agent? Let's find out!
To learn more about crypto AI agents, read this blog for a detailed study.
Why Build Your Own Crypto AI Agent?


Before we begin building an AI crypto agent or a crypto AI agent (they're synonymous), it's essential to have clarity about its purpose. There can be several reasons to develop an AI agent, including its autonomous and predictive capabilities that drive its machine learning and reasoning capabilities.
Similar‚Ä¶
articles.title: Guide To Build Your Own Crypto AI Agent

articles.author: Mateus Valentim
articles.description:
This year, I completed the Full Stack Development course at Infinity School, an incredible experience that exposed me to many areas of the tech world. I also began my academic journey in Computer Engineering at the University of Fortaleza. At the same time, I enrolled in Infinity School's Full Stack course ‚Äî and wow, they really prepare students for the professional world!
While university focuses on theoretical and scientific subjects, Infinity School offered a more practical, professional perspective. These are two distinct approaches, and I realized how valuable both are. The course at Infinity School even helped me better understand topics in my university studies.
Throughout the course, I overcame challenges that deepened my programming skills and helped me grow as a developer. Thanks to the excellent teaching and charismatic instructors, I now feel more confident in my abilities.
As I continue my studies and career, I‚Äôm excited to apply what I‚Äôve learned and look forward to the future with enthusiasm. Thank you, Infinity School! You‚Äôll always be part of my professional journey. üòä
Couse Certiication:

Letter Recommedantion:

English Translate
articles.title: My Journey with Infinity School and Computer Engineering

articles.author: Shifa
articles.description:
Here's a clear and informative article on Type Conversion in JavaScript ‚Äî perfect for your audience of developers and code enthusiasts:
Type conversion is a core concept in JavaScript that every developer‚Äîwhether beginner or experienced‚Äîmust understand. JavaScript is a dynamically typed language, which means variables can hold values of any type without explicit declarations. This flexibility comes with a caveat: JavaScript automatically converts types when necessary, sometimes in ways that can be surprising.
In this article, we‚Äôll explore:
What type conversion is
Implicit vs explicit conversion
Common conversion scenarios
Gotchas to avoid
Type conversion refers to changing a value from one data type to another, such as from a string to a number. JavaScript supports two types of conversion‚Ä¶
articles.title: "WARNING: JavaScript Type Conversion Could Be Destroying Your App!"

articles.author: Leon Martin
articles.description:
Let‚Äôs get one thing out of the way: watching programming tutorials feels productive.
You fire up a two-hour crash course, follow along, copy the code, maybe even understand most of it... and when it ends, you feel good. Like you made real progress.
But here‚Äôs the uncomfortable truth:
Watching tutorials doesn‚Äôt make you an expert. It barely even makes you competent.
Tutorial Watching ‚â† Real Coding


Following along with a tutorial is like painting by numbers.

The colors are picked for you. The lines are drawn.

You‚Äôre just filling in the blanks.
Real coding?

You‚Äôre staring at a blank canvas, trying to figure out what the hell to even draw.
No instructions. No handholding. Just you, a vague idea, and a stubborn compiler screaming at you.
Until you can build something without a step-by-step‚Ä¶
articles.title: Watching Tutorials Doesn‚Äôt Make You an Expert

articles.author: JennyThomas498
articles.description:
Abstract:

This post explores the evolving landscape of blockchain funding and decentralized exchanges (DEXs). We will delve into traditional methods and modern innovations such as ICOs, STOs, IEOs, and DAOs, then examine the technological breakthroughs powering DEXs. With a focus on interoperability, Layer 2 and Layer 3 scaling, regulatory changes, and even AI integration, we paint a holistic picture of how blockchain is reshaping financial ecosystems. In addition to insights from the original article on blockchain project funding and decentralized exchanges, we incorporate additional perspectives on governance models, sustainability challenges, and cutting-edge trends from trusted sources.
Blockchain technology has revolutionized industries beyond finance. Today, its impact extends into ‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Future of Blockchain Funding and Decentralized Exchanges

articles.author: Leonhard Kwahle
articles.description:
K-Means is an easy yet powerful algorithm that organizes data into groups based on similarity. It's widely used in customer segmentation, image compression, and more‚Äîperfect for making sense of messy data.
Before we dive into how K-Means works, let‚Äôs first understand what clustering actually means.
Clustering referes to the task of identifying similar instances in a dataset and assigning them to unlabelled groups called clusters.
It is widely applicable in areas like
Customer segmentation : group customers based on their purchase and activity in an e-commerce site
-Data analysis: when analyzing a large dataset. Think of performing inferential statistics. You can perform a clustering algorithm to see variety groups in the data set and that will play an important role in your sampling algori‚Ä¶
articles.title: K-Means Clustering Made Simple: Grouping Data the Smart Way

articles.description:
The United Kingdom‚Äôs Treasury and Chancellor of the Exchequer, Rachel Reeves, have proposed new crypto rules aimed at ‚Äúsupport[ing] innovation while cracking down on fraudsters.‚Äù
In an April 29 notice, the UK government announced draft rules for cryptocurrencies, including Bitcoin (BTC) and Ether (ETH), that would bring ‚Äúcrypto exchanges, dealers and agents‚Äù in line with regulations, as many residents were ‚Äúexposed to risky firms and scams.‚Äù It cited discussions with US government officials, including a proposed US-UK cross-border sandbox from the Securities and Exchange Commission‚Äôs Hester Peirce.
‚ÄúToday‚Äôs announcement sends a clear signal: Britain is open for business ‚Äî but closed to fraud, abuse, and instability,‚Äù said the notice. ‚ÄúThe government will bring forward final cryptoasset leg‚Ä¶
articles.title: UK gov't proposes crypto rules in response to scams

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Felix Xu
articles.description:
Opinion by: Felix Xu, co-founder of ARPA Network and Bella Protocol
AI has been a dominant narrative since 2024, but users and companies still cannot completely trust it. Whether it‚Äôs finances, personal data or healthcare decisions, hesitation around AI‚Äôs reliability and integrity remains high.
This growing AI trust deficit is now one of the most significant barriers to widespread adoption. Decentralized, privacy-preserving technologies are quickly being recognized as viable solutions that offer verifiability, transparency and stronger data protection without compromising AI‚Äôs growth.
The pervasive AI trust deficit¬†
AI was the second most popular category occupying crypto mindshare in 2024, with over 16% investor interest. Startups and multinational companies have allocated considerable re‚Ä¶
articles.title: AI has a trust problem ‚Äî Decentralized privacy-preserving tech can fix it

Glassnode reveals that the sum of coins which last moved up to a week ago has reached its largest figure since early February.
‚ÄúThis metric captures short-‚Ä¶

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Cryptocurrency compliance firm Bitrace found that $649 billion worth of stablecoins flowed through addresses classified as high-risk in 2024, according to an April 29 report.
Bitrace defines high-risk blockchain addresses as those used by illegal entities to receive, transfer or store stablecoins.
Crypto compliance firms typically score crypto wallet addresses based on their likelihood of involvement in illicit activities. The higher the risk, the higher the likelihood of foul play, and the less likely compliant crypto businesses are to accept the assets.
Per the report, the amount accounted for roughly 5.14% of all stablecoin transaction volume in 2024. This is down 0.8% from 5.94% the previous year, but significantly higher than the 2.8% reported in 2022 and 1.63% in 2021.
Proportion of ‚Ä¶
articles.title: $649B stablecoin transfers linked to illicit activity in 2024: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
The United States‚Äô rejection of a central bank digital currency has not halted the progress of CBDCs globally, but their success has been questionable so far, according to a former Binance executive.
Global CBDC projects have not failed, but they have also not become what they were anticipated to be, according to Olga Goncharova, CEO at the consulting firm Rizz Go and former director of government relations in the Commonwealth of Independent States at Binance.
‚ÄúCBDCs were conceived as a technological breakthrough, but so far they look like expensive imitations of existing traditional fiat currencies that citizens and businesses already use through online banking and payment apps,‚Äù Goncharova told Cointelegraph at the Blockchain Forum in Moscow.
Olga Goncharova during a panel on Web3 geopol‚Ä¶
articles.title: CBDCs ‚Äòcostly fiat copy‚Äô, not fintech success so far: Ex-Binance exec

The implementation is expected to start this year and continue until 2027.
The announcement. Source: Beijing government
The Beijing Blockchain Innovation and Application Development Action Plan recognizes blockchain as a ‚Äúcritical foundational technology for industrial digitalization and vital digital infrastructure.‚Äù 
Notably, the obje‚Ä¶

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
A16z Crypto led a $25 million investment round into Miden, an independent blockchain project spun out of Polygon Labs.
Miden closed its $25 million seed rounds led by a16z Crypto, 1kx, and Hack VC, with participation from Finality Capital Partners, Symbolic Capital, P2 Ventures, Delta Fund, MH Ventures, as well as from angel investors, including MakerDAO‚Äôs Rune Christensen and EigenLayer‚Äôs Sreeram Kannan.
Miden is a zero-knowledge (ZK) proof-powered blockchain focused on high scalability through its hybrid consensus mode, which moves transaction execution from the mainnet on ‚Äúedge devices,‚Äù referring to users‚Äô devices.
Designed for institutions that value confidentiality, Miden enables applications to execute both public and private transactions with full privacy, according to an April 29 ‚Ä¶
articles.title: A16z leads $25M funding for Miden blockchain project

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Aaron Wood
articles.description:
The first 100 days of the administration of US President Donald Trump have deeply impacted the crypto industry, starting with his own memecoin and culminating in a Bitcoin reserve and a spate of blockchain policymaking.¬†
Trump‚Äôs trade war with the entire world has had the largest short-term impact on crypto markets, as crypto prices have wavered amid macroeconomic worry and uncertainty. Higher prices on electronics mean Bitcoin (BTC) miners are finding it harder to break even, and de-dollarization concerns abound.¬†
Still, crypto markets have shown some resilience and cause for optimism in the administration‚Äôs crypto-friendly policies. A number of pro-crypto leaders have been appointed to key government agencies, including the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Commodity Futures Tra‚Ä¶
articles.title: Trump‚Äôs first 100 days ‚Äòworst in history‚Äô despite crypto promises

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
USDC stablecoin issuer Circle has received in-principle approval (IPA) from the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) of the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM), the company announced on April 29.
The approval moves Circle closer to obtaining a full Financial Services Permission (FSP) license, allowing it to operate as a regulated money services provider in the United Arab Emirates, the firm said in an official press release.
Jeremy Allaire, Circle‚Äôs Co-Founder and CEO, said the approval ‚Äúadvances our strategy to establish deep roots in markets embracing the onchain economy.‚Äù He added:
‚ÄúIt also underscores Circle‚Äôs enduring commitment to global stablecoin oversight‚Äîstrengthening trust, compliance, and adoption worldwide, while laying a resilient foundation for the internet financial sy‚Ä¶
articles.title: Circle gets Abu Dhabi regulatory nod to expand in Middle East

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Bitcoin mining firm Phoenix Group announced the addition of 52 megawatts (MW) worth of mining capacity to its capabilities in Ethiopia.
According to an April 29 announcement, with this latest addition, Phoenix‚Äôs Bitcoin mining capacity in Ethiopia reaches 132 MW. The firm‚Äôs global capacity now reportedly exceeds 500 MW.
Phoenix‚Äôs co-founder and CEO, Munaf Ali, said the firm‚Äôs strategy relies on ‚Äúsecuring prime locations with abundant, low-cost energy.‚Äù
‚ÄúInitiatives like our latest expansion in Ethiopia are pivotal steps, not only creating significant value today but also solidifying our position,‚Äù he said.
Related: Arkansas city rejects crypto mining proposal after community pushback
Building on previous agreements
The news follows Phoenix Group signing an agreement that secures the right ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin miner Phoenix Group adds 52 MW of mining capacity in Ethiopia

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Sasha Shilina
articles.description:
What is digital identity?            
            
                
Your digital identity is the fingerprint you leave across the internet, a living map of who you are.
Your digital identity is more than just your name or email; it stretches from your social media profiles and crypto wallet addresses to your device fingerprints and even the rhythms of your daily browsing habits. In the fast-moving world of cryptocurrency, where identity and financial access often overlap, digital identity theft isn‚Äôt just a nuisance; it‚Äôs an open door to your assets.¬†

Without strong protection, even small pieces of stolen information can be stitched into a full profile, giving cybercriminals everything they need to impersonate you, seize your funds or lock you out of your accounts.
What many don‚Äôt realize‚Ä¶
articles.title: Your digital identity got stolen ‚Äî Now what?

BlackRock‚Äôs exchange-traded fund (ETF) bought nearly $1 billion worth of Bitcoin on behalf of its clients on April 28, with continued inflows providing ‚Äústructural support‚Äù for Bitcoin‚Äôs price appreciation, according to market analysts.
BlackRock‚Äôs iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) ETF bought $970 million worth of Bitcoin (BTC) on April 28, its second-largest day of inflows on record after scooping up $1.12 billion of BTC on Nov. 7, 2024, Sosovalue data shows.
IBIT ETF Inflows, all-time chart. Source: Sosovalue¬†
IBIT‚Äôs near $1 billion investment brought total net inflows to US spot BTC ETFs to just above $590 million, with all other ETFs realizing net negative outflows or remaining flat. ARK Invest‚Äôs ARKB ETF recorded the highest outflows of $226 million.

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
DeFi protocol Loopscale has recovered nearly half of the funds stolen during a major exploit over the weekend, as white hat negotiations with the attacker show signs of progress.
In an April 29 update posted to X, Loopscale confirmed that approximately 19,463 Wrapped SOL (WSOL) (worth roughly $2.88 million) have been returned to its wallets since April 28.
The first two returns included 10,000 WSOL (~$1.48 million) and 4,463 WSOL (~$660,000), following an earlier recovery of 5,000 WSOL (~$740,000).
‚ÄúOur pursuit of an amicable resolution regarding Saturday‚Äôs incident continues to make progress,‚Äù the team wrote.
Loopscale updating community on negotiations progress. Source: Loopscale
Related: DeFi platform KiloEx to compensate users impacted by $7.5M hack
Loopscale offers 10% bounty for retu‚Ä¶
articles.title: Loopscale recovers $2.8M after weekend DeFi hack and bounty talks

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
Alex Mashinsky, the founder and former CEO of the now-defunct cryptocurrency lending platform Celsius, faces a 20-year prison sentence as the US Department of Justice (DOJ) seeks a severe penalty for his role in a multibillion-dollar fraud.
The DOJ on April 28 filed the government‚Äôs sentencing memorandum against Mashinsky, recommending a 20-year prison sentence for his fraudulent actions, which led to billions of dollars in losses for Celsius customers.
The 97-page memo mentioned that Celsius users were unable to access approximately $4.7 billion in crypto assets after the platform halted withdrawals on June 12, 2022.
‚ÄúThe Court should sentence Alexander Mashinsky to twenty years‚Äô imprisonment as just punishment for his years-long campaign of lies and self-dealing that left in its wake bil‚Ä¶
articles.title: US DOJ requests 20-year sentence for Celsius founder Alex Mashinsky

BTC/USD remains in a ‚Äúcritical zone‚Äù pending fresh support confirmations.

Bitcoin (BTC) has broken through three key resistance levels in a week, but its biggest reclaim battle continues.
Analysis from sources including popular trader and analyst Rekt Capital underscores BTC price acting in a critical area for bulls.
Bitcoin breaks through ‚Äútriple resistance‚Äù
Bitcoin‚Äôs latest weekly candle saw a reclaim of a full three resistance lines, Rekt Capital reveals.
In addition to horizontal weekly resistance, BTC/USD broke beyond a multimonth downtrend previous‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin in 'critical zone' as triple breakout meets $93.5K support battle

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Shailey Singh
articles.description:
What is the Paws Telegram Mini App?            
            
                
Paws is a Telegram-based Mini App created by the same team behind other projects, such as Notcoin and Dogs.¬†
If you‚Äôve been cruising around Telegram lately, chances are you‚Äôve stumbled upon Paws, the viral crypto Mini App that‚Äôs got everyone tapping, clicking and inviting their friends like it‚Äôs 2010 FarmVille all over again.¬†
Originally launched in October 2024 on The Open Network (TON) blockchain, Paws exploded in popularity with its ultra-simple tap-to-earn concept. Think of it as a gamified rewards engine embedded directly in Telegram, where users rack up points by completing tasks, referring others and interacting with mini-game elements.¬†
Within just eight days of going live, Paws pulled in over 20 million ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Is the Paws Telegram mini app legit? What you need to know

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Decentralized exchange (DEX) aggregator 1inch has launched on Solana, marking a significant step toward its vision of a ‚Äúunified multichain‚Äù decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem.
According to a press release shared with Cointelegraph, the integration enables users to trade over 1 million Solana-based tokens directly through the 1inch decentralized application (DApp), benefiting from maximal extractable value-protected swaps, optimized rates and open-source smart contract infrastructure.
The move brings 1inch‚Äôs Fusion protocol to Solana for the first time. Fusion enables users to define their ideal swap parameters, which are then executed by competing professional market makers, or ‚Äúresolvers,‚Äù using Dutch auction mechanics.
Combined with Solana‚Äôs ultra-fast block times, the setup promise‚Ä¶
articles.title: 1inch launches on Solana with crosschain swaps in the pipeline

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
The concept of a Russian ruble stablecoin received special attention at a major local crypto event, the Blockchain Forum in Moscow, with key industry executives reflecting on some of the core features a ruble-backed stablecoin might require.
Sergey Mendeleev, founder of the digital settlement exchange Exved and inactive founder of the sanctioned Garantex exchange, put forward seven key criteria for a potential ‚Äúreplica of Tether‚Äù in a keynote at the Blockchain Forum on April 23.
Mendeleev said a potential ruble stablecoin must have untraceable transactions and allow transfers without Know Your Customer (KYC) checks.
However, because one of the criteria also requires the stablecoin to comply with Russian regulations, he expressed skepticism that such a product could emerge soon.
The DAI mod‚Ä¶
articles.title: Russian ruble stablecoin: Exec lists 7 ‚ÄòTether replica‚Äô features

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
A trio of major Abu Dhabi institutions, including the Emirate‚Äôs sovereign wealth fund, have teamed up to launch a new dirham-pegged stablecoin.
Abu Dhabi‚Äôs sovereign wealth fund ADQ, the United Arab Emirates‚Äô largest bank, First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB), and the massive conglomerate the International Holding Company, have partnered to launch the stablecoin, pending regulatory approval, the three companies said on April 28.
The trio said the stablecoin would be regulated by the UAE‚Äôs central bank and backed by the country‚Äôs currency, the dirham. It will also support use cases such as machine-to-machine and artificial intelligence.
Source: IHC
The goal is to place the UAE at the ‚Äúforefront of global blockchain innovation,‚Äù while also strengthening the digital infrastructure, according to ADQ.
If‚Ä¶
articles.title: Abu Dhabi institutional giants team up for dirham stablecoin

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
The founders of the crypto fintech firm Bankera used funds from the project‚Äôs 2018 initial coin offering to purchase luxury properties worldwide, according to a report by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project.
The OCCRP reported on April 28, citing leaked company records and bank statements, that nearly half of the funds from Bankera‚Äôs 100 million euro ($114 million) ICO were transferred to a bank in the Pacific Island country of Vanuatu that was purchased by the project‚Äôs founders, Vytautas Karaleviƒçius, Justas Dobiliauskas and Mantas Mockeviƒçius.
Soon after, the Vanuatu bank reportedly began issuing millions of euros in loans to companies owned by the trio to build a luxury real estate portfolio ‚Äî including a villa in the French Riviera and high-end property in Lithuania, ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bankera founders used ICO funds on global property buys: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Researchers at the University of Zurich have been accused of undertaking an unauthorized four-month-long experiment on a Reddit board using artificial intelligence-generated comments to test whether AI could alter people‚Äôs opinions.¬†
As part of the experiment, AI-powered accounts faked a variety of personas, including a rape victim, a person opposed to specific social movements and a trauma counselor specializing in abuse, moderators of the r/changemyview subreddit said in an April 26 post.
‚ÄúOur sub is a decidedly human space that rejects undisclosed AI as a core value,‚Äù the moderators said. ‚ÄúPeople do not come here to discuss their views with AI or to be experimented upon.‚Äù¬†
The researchers used AI to generate responses but attempted to personalize the replies based on information from th‚Ä¶
articles.title: Zurich Uni‚Äôs secret AI experiment manipulated Redditors‚Äô opinions

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
US federal prosecutors and the co-founders of the crypto mixer Samourai Wallet have asked a court for more time to consider potentially dismissing the case after the Justice Department rolled back its crypto enforcement.
Lawyers for Samourai Wallet CEO Keonne Rodriguez and chief technology officer William Hill said in an April 28 letter to Manhattan federal judge Richard Berman that they jointly requested with the government ‚Äúfor a continuance of the pretrial motions schedule by 16 days.‚Äù
The Samourai executives' lawyers said on April 10 that they wrote to Acting Manhattan US Attorney Jay Clayton to request the dismissal of the case after an April 7 memo from Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche shuttered the Justice Department‚Äôs crypto team.
‚ÄúOn April 24, 2025, defense counsel met with th‚Ä¶
articles.title: Samourai Wallet, feds ask for time to mull dropping crypto mixer case

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
While United States dollar-denominated stablecoins dominate the stablecoin and real-world asset (RWA) tokenization game, other competitors are coming into play, according to Tether co-founder Reeve Collins.¬†
Speaking to Cointelegraph in Dubai, Collins said that while dollar-backed stablecoins may be dominant, other currencies and assets may compete to back stablecoins.
‚ÄúThe stablecoin definitely helps preserve the dollar dominance, especially in the crypto space,‚Äù Collins said. ‚ÄúThe dollar is kind of the reserve currency of crypto. But now there are other currencies coming into play. But more importantly, it‚Äôs not currencies. It‚Äôs other types of backing,‚Äù he added.
Collins said that other assets used to back stablecoins may compete with US dollars by bringing a higher yield to users.¬†
Inte‚Ä¶
articles.title: US dollar facing growing competition for stablecoin dominance: Tether co-founder

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Legendary investor Ray Dalio has said the world is ‚Äúon the brink‚Äù of the global monetary order breaking down, which is being accelerated by the Trump administration‚Äôs tariff disruptions.
The trade tensions are fracturing the monetary, political and international world orders by fueling deglobalization and unsustainable trade imbalances, Dalio, the former CEO of hedge fund Bridgewater Associates, said in an April 28 X post.
Dalio added that this is leading to irreversible damage, and an increasing number of importers and exporters, particularly between the US and China, are drastically reducing interdependencies and ‚Äúmaking alternative plans.‚Äù
‚Äú[They‚Äôre] recognizing that whatever happens with tariffs, these problems won't go away, and that radically reduced interdependencies with the US is ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ray Dalio says global monetary order ‚Äòon the brink‚Äô of breakdown

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
The crypto lobby group, the DeFi Education Fund, has petitioned the Trump administration to end what it claimed was the ‚Äúlawless prosecution‚Äù of open-source software developers, including Roman Storm, a creator of the crypto mixing service Tornado Cash.
In an April 28 letter to White House crypto czar David Sacks, the group urged President Donald Trump ‚Äúto take immediate action to discontinue the Biden-era Department of Justice's lawless campaign to criminalize open-source software development.‚Äù¬†
The letter specifically mentioned the prosecution of Storm, who was charged in August 2023 with helping launder over $1 billion in crypto through Tornado Cash. His trial is still set for July, and his fellow charged co-founder, Roman Semenov, is at large and believed to be in Russia.
The DeFi Educ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto group asks Trump to end prosecution of crypto devs, Roman Storm
